page.topic: Adding a Button-List to a ControlBar
page.description: A common pattern in mobile apps is to have a button bar at the bottom of the screen with a series of buttons that allow you to select the active Panel that is shown on the device. Typically, these buttons are spread out so that they fill the width of the screen. The button-list control is ideal for implementing this pattern.

section.description: To see how a Button-List can be configured to fill the width of the screen, and to select a Panel Card in a Panel Layout when one of the buttons in the Button-List is tapped, watch this three part video: [Part 1], [Part 2], [Part 3]. You can also follow the guide below.

section.title: Create a Panel Navigator with Panel Cards and a ControlBar

step.description: In the UX Builder on the UX Controls page check the 'Mobile' checkbox.
Open the 'Panels' menu. Select the [Panel Navigator] option to add a Panel Navigator to the component.
Highlight the Panel Navigator. In the properties list, on the right, change the 'Navigator type' property to 'Programmatic'.
Open the Panels menu again and click on [Panel Card] to add a Panel Card to the Panel Navigator. Name this panel 'PANELCARD_HOME'.
Highlight [Panel Card End: PANELCARD_HOME]. Click on the [Panel Card] option again to add a second panel card to the component. Name this panel card 'PANELCARD_CHARTS'.
Highlight [Panel Card End: PANELCARD_CHARTS]. Add a third panel card to the component. Name this panel card 'PANELCARD_SETTINGS'.
Highlight PANELCARD_HOME. Open the 'Other Controls' menu and click on the [Static Text] option to add a static text control to PANELCARD_HOME.
Highlight the static text property. In the Static Text Properties section on the right change the 'Static text' property to read 'This is the Home Panel'.
Highlight PANELCARD_CHARTS. Click on [Static Text] again to add a static text control to PANELCARD_CHARTS. Set the 'Static text' property to read 'This is the Charts Panel'
Highlight PANELCARD_SETTINGS. Add a [Static Text] control to this panel card and set the 'Static text' to read 'This is the Settings Panel'.
Highlight [Panel Card End: PANELCARD_SETTINGS]. Open the Containers menu and click the [Container] option.
From the Container Type list select the 'PanelFooter' option and click 'Insert After'.
Highlight the Panel Footer and open the 'Other Controls' menu. Select the [ControlBar] option to add a ControlBar to the Panel Footer.
